title: 114_hr245
content: The text chunk is about the codification of effective dates for claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The text chunk provides definitions related to claims for benefits under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. It includes definitions for terms such as claimant, claim, formal claim, and informal claim. The text chunk defines terms related to claims for benefits under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, including formal and informal claims, reasonably raised claims, and the requirements for submitting a claim. The text chunk amends sections related to informal claims and effective dates for benefit applications under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. It outlines the process for submitting formal claims and considers informal requests for claim increases or reopenings. The text chunk introduces a new section regarding the treatment of reasonably raised claims in the process of addressing or adjudicating any claim under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The text introduces a new section regarding the treatment of reasonably raised claims in the process of addressing claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The beginning of this chapter is amended by inserting a new item after the section relating to 5103A. The amendments made by this Act regarding the treatment of reasonably raised claims will be effective on the date of enactment and apply to claims submitted on or after that date.
